Freddie Quell.Action: Admits to liking to drink and acknowledges it as a weakness.
Talks about his Auntie Bertha who raised him, showing a personal and sincere side.
Responds minimally and somewhat evasively to the doctor's questions, showing reluctance to open up fully.
Communicates with the doctor about his situation and shows some awareness of his limitations, such as avoiding heavy lifting.
Plans to go to Placerville to work with a friend, despite not contacting the friend and being uncertain about his circumstances.
Tries college but admits it didn't work, showing a lack of success in formal education.
Is able to engage in a conversation with the doctor and defend the meaning of his tattoo, showing some personal insight and communication skill.
Expresses desire to repay hospital and doctor despite not owing them personally.
Admits to impulsive, aggressive urges (hitting people's hats off).
Shares personal vulnerability and uncertainty about survival and luck.
Expresses determination to repay hospital and doctor despite his difficult situation.
Admits he cannot be an orderly due to physical/mental demands but considers other options like running an elevator.
Recognizes his own near-death experience and reflects on his luck and survival.
Mentions inability to control impulses (wanting to hit hats off), showing volatile behavior.
Interacts with various customers including military men, single ladies, families, toddlers, old couples, and newly married couples, suggesting approachability and friendliness.
Engages in playful, somewhat sincere banter with Donna, shares his homemade liquor, and shares a kiss with her.
Works at the portrait studio interacting with various customers, showing ability to engage different people.
Successfully initiates a casual, somewhat flirtatious conversation with Donna, adapting to social cues.
Offers Donna homemade alcohol from his flask, acknowledging its dangerous nature humorously.
Agrees to Donna's invitation to go out, shows casual friendliness.
Gives a straightforward compliment to Donna about her breasts when asked.
Loses temper with the irritable businessman, knocks over equipment, steals camera and homemade liquor while ranting and raving.
Shouts a few sweet words to Donna as he runs off from the security guards.
Agrees to Donna's invitation to go out and engages in conversation, showing some social adaptability.
Loses temper with the irritable business man and knocks over equipment, then impulsively steals a camera and film processing chemicals while ranting.
Has Filipino and Mexican workers helping him prepare drinks with homemade vodka.
Is very vicious in a fight with local kids.
Suggests to silence the extremely drunk Filipino man who is passing out and moaning.
Notices the drunk Filipino man's worsening condition but quietly backs away and starts to leave instead of helping.
Runs away when the Filipino men yell after him and give chase.
Hitches a ride and looks for work diligently at the docks, showing self-sufficiency but no clear social interaction.
Boards a private yacht unchallenged, possibly indicating an opportunistic behavior but no direct interpersonal warmth or hostility displayed.
Sneaks around below deck and takes a tuxedo to blend in with the group of young men.
Works near the bar delivering drinks to guests at the cocktail party, blending into a happy, chatty crowd.
Shares a private moment with the bartender by sneaking two shots and drinking them together.
Finds a small closet with a tuxedo and slips it on to blend in with a group of young men, acting as if he belongs.
Works near the bar, delivering drinks at a cocktail party.
Sneaks two shots of alcohol with the bartender and immediately gets a pounding headache.
Walks off when feeling unwell after drinking; falls flat on his face and is dragged off.
Answers questions coherently despite sedation and confusion.
Asserts that he is a good worker and knowledgeable about ships.
Responds briefly and somewhat evasively to the Master's friendly offers and questions.
Shows willingness to work and a straightforward claim of being a seaman looking for a berth.
Closes his eyes and appears sleepy, somewhat disengaged during conversation.
States 'I am' confidently when asked if he is an able bodied seamen.
Closes his eyes, appears sleepy and drunk during conversation.
Answers questions simply and sometimes evasively; fails to explain himself clearly.
Clearly states he is looking for work and knows ships.
Does not take advantage of offered help to join ship crew openly, instead skulks and sneaks.
Asks 'What do you do your company?' showing some curiosity about the company.
Responds briefly and evasively to questions, avoids engagement with interviewer.
Expresses aggression openly ('I'll kill you').
Gives short, almost monosyllabic replies; resists social interaction.
Responds with short, often evasive or non-informative answers, showing confusion or disengagement during interrogation.
States he served in the Navy and operated the torpedo room on the USS Barton, acknowledging he killed people.
Fails to provide clear or detailed answers about his background or purpose, repeating phrases like 'wakemeup' and seems disoriented.
Chooses a ship simply because it was leaving, indicating a reactive rather than strategic decision.
Accepts invitation to stay and receive guidance without complaint.
Passes out again after suggestion to rest, showing vulnerability and lack of resistance.
Agrees to stay with the Master and accepts help without hesitation.
Passes out after closing his eyes, showing weakness and lack of control.
Is dragged passively down the hallways by assistants, showing lack of agency or control.
Wakes up and looks around the room and outside the window, showing some awareness and observational behavior.
Responds politely to a young girl’s friendly greeting with no visible hostility or rudeness.
Engages in conversation with the Master without hostility, listens and responds calmly despite a previous aggressive episode.
Denies surrendering himself despite implication from Master, shows defensiveness but not overt aggression.
Questions the Master about work and the ship, showing practical interest rather than rudeness or disinterest.
Challenges Master's claim he was acting aggressively and refuses to admit fault, showing some tension but no explicit hostility.
Walks confidently into the Master's room and engages in casual but direct conversation about his status and work prospects.
Appears uncertain or evasive when asked about what was in his drink, suggesting some confusion or vulnerability.
Questions the Master's assumptions about his behavior and asserts he did not surrender himself, showing some degree of self-awareness and assertiveness.
Responds to the Master's suggestion to ask directly for work with a vague answer about readiness to go rather than a clear affirmative, indicating some uncertainty or hesitation.
Apologizes for getting out of hand last night, acknowledges his behavior openly.
Insists he has no trouble and is ready to work immediately without hesitation.
Directly questions the Master's motives and ownership without hostility, showing straightforwardness.
Asks directly for a job despite being told he is not fit to work, showing persistence and straightforwardness.
Does not understand or question the term 'aberrated' and seems unaware of his condition, indicating lack of self-awareness.
Confidently insists he can do any job given, showing self-assurance and readiness.
Fails to fully grasp the consequences or reasons behind the Master's warnings about his condition and being hunted, suggesting limited insight.
Apologizes for overstepping the previous night and tries to explain his motives honestly, reflecting an ability to self-correct social mistakes.
Shares a moment of laughter and smiles with Master after admitting the hooch is 'horrible'.
Reluctantly considers joining Master’s community event despite initial hesitation.
Refuses to say yes to something he does not understand, showing cautiousness rather than openness.
Refuses to say yes to something he doesn't understand, demonstrates carefulness and some critical thinking.
Uncertain if he can reproduce the potion (booze), says 'maybe' instead of confidently affirming ability.
Calls the potion 'just booze' and recognizes it as 'horrible hooch,' showing practical familiarity with his craft.
Checks mirror and cleans up, wears a nice suit, walks with Master, is welcomed warmly by others on board including bride and groom.
Responds briefly and somewhat uncertainly to Master's questions, shows limited verbal engagement.
Responds politely and simply to Val's introduction and questions.
Looks around at everyone celebrating, notices a young woman and then her husband, but does not engage or intrude.
Engages politely in conversation with Val, but gives vague or uncertain answers about his work and experience.
Observes others and the social atmosphere, showing some situational awareness by noticing the young woman and her husband.
Responds amicably and without conflict to bartender's questions and greetings.
Offers to make the Master’s potion whenever asked and agrees to take care of the task.
Observes the celebration quietly, caught up in the event but does not actively engage.
Accepts accommodations and a book from others without complaint, quietly reads and falls asleep.
Sits down to eat with Mary Sue and observes the children around
Listens attentively when Mary Sue explains the challenges faced by her husband and others
Asks questions out of genuine curiosity ('Who's attacking him?', 'What's a time-hole?')
Sits down with Mary Sue and asks questions showing curiosity about 'who's attacking him' and 'what's a time-hole'
Passively watches the Dunbars’ exercise without active participation or clear understanding
Moves around collecting various supplies to make homemade booze, indicating resourcefulness and a willingness to engage with others by accepting help from the bartender/follower.

Watches a group of followers reading and studying, and listens to the Master's lecture by slipping on headphones and taking a seat among them, showing openness and willingness to connect with the community.
Tries to flirt and make eye contact with all the women while in the study room, demonstrating attempts at friendly social interaction but possibly overly forward or insincere.
Collects various supplies (potatoes, paint thinner, oranges, yeast) to start making a homemade booze potion by distillation on the ship.
Sets up a distillation area and begins making booze using found ingredients, apparently with some help from the bartender.
Slips on a pair of headphones and listens attentively to a recorded lecture by the Master in a study room.
Attempts to flirt and make eye contact with women in the study room while listening to the Master’s lecture.
Responds briefly and somewhat reservedly to the Aid's concern about his comprehension, admits 'not really' following well.
Initiates polite conversation by asking the Aid's name and recognizing his own.
Engages quietly with others, such as greeting Elizabeth with a simple 'Hi' and accepting her message.
Withdraws to put booze into mason jars, showing an avoidance or private focus instead of social interaction.
Admits to not following or understanding material, but persists in listening and reading, showing willingness to learn.
Struggles to understand humor and social cues in the sketch comedy show, indicating gaps in social or intellectual comprehension.
Puts booze into mason jars presumably to hide or control his drinking, indicating some resourcefulness or problem-solving.
Pours the strong drink and warns about its strength, indicating some awareness and caution.
Answers questions from the Master in a straightforward manner, showing cooperative and responsive behavior.
Agrees to the Master's informal processing and participates by following instructions calmly.
Repeatedly says his full name as instructed, showing compliance but no demonstration of self-reflection or deeper insight.
Responds that he 'usually puts some thought' into remarks, indicating some self-awareness.
Admits he is impulsive in behavior.
Says other people don’t interest him much except girls.
Expresses general suspicion of people as "ass's".
Claims he is usually truthful but also sometimes unsure.
Responds with some humor when asked about past failures.
Laughs hysterically and responds playfully to the Master’s questions.
Expresses willingness to engage and have fun with the Master’s questioning.
Answers questions frankly and without hesitation when prompted.
Screams unexpectedly and laughs hysterically, indicating spontaneous and somewhat erratic behavior.
Engages cooperatively with the Master’s questioning, expresses readiness to continue and participate.
Accepts challenging task of answering questions without blinking and tries to comply.
Fails initial task by blinking and having to restart multiple times.
Answers questions honestly and without hesitation once task is underway.
Answers honestly about incestuous acts without evasion.
Expresses no regret or apparent emotional connection about past incestuous encounters.
Does not wish to reconnect or see his aunt again.
Unable or unwilling to provide information about where his family members are.
Expresses frustration, self-directed anger (slaps himself, curses), showing emotional distress and vulnerability.
Acknowledges feelings of inferiority and lack of hope for salvation.
Answers repeatedly and candidly to Master’s probing, including uncomfortable admissions without hesitation.
Maintains composure during recording, does not blink despite intense questioning.
Unable to recall or provide information about his family members' current whereabouts.
Responds with profanity and self-directed anger after being detained in the questioning sequence.
Shows awareness of his own perceived inferiority and lack of divine salvation.
Admits frankly to incest and lying, shows no evident remorse or concealment.
Openly confesses to killing enemy soldiers during the war, seems straightforward rather than evasive.
Admits to possibly blinding a man by serving him excessive alcohol, blames victim's stupidity rather than own responsibility.
Demonstrates awareness that his homemade booze could be harmful but downplays risk if consumed wisely.
Shows lack of knowledge about family background and uncertain about whereabouts of parents.
Provides straightforward explanation of incest motivated by promised inheritance and physical attraction, indicating some blunt honesty.
Expresses enduring love and admiration for Doris Schoemann, calling her the best girl he ever met and the love of his life.
Admits to being an idiot and not knowing why he is not with Doris, showing vulnerability and self-awareness.
Calls the Master and Mary Sue fools initially, indicating distrust or disdain before changing his opinion.
Acknowledges bad thoughts about people he is connected to, but eventually admits seeing them in a better light.
Acknowledges he is an idiot and cannot explain why he is not with Doris despite loving her.
Expresses confidence that Doris Schoemann is the best girl he ever met and that he will marry her one day.
States he feels entitled to his inheritance and that he believed others were fools but now sees they are not.
Follows instructions during the session attentively and reports feeling good, showing responsiveness and engagement.
Responds politely and cooperatively during questioning without hostility.
Drinks booze together with Master, sharing a moment of camaraderie with smiles and laughter.
Answers questions clearly and honestly during the interrogation, shows awareness of his own affiliations.
Does not display any confusion or hesitation when questioned, remains composed.
Slides onto the motorcycle, starts it up smoothly, and rides off confidently as others watch and applaud.
Looks at the girls during the reception instead of actively engaging with the event or contributing to the work being done.
Brings the Master some booze and toasts with him, performing a supportive role quietly without directing or leading the group's activities.
Carries over an old reel to reel tape player and sets it on a coffee table in front of him to presumably aid the Master’s presentation.
No direct action by Freddie Quell in this excerpt; only the Master is interacting with the equipment and explaining concepts.
Shares a personal and vulnerable story about a past injury and a frightening experience in the sewers.
Stuffs stolen gold in a drain hole and manages to evade capture despite serious injury.
Suffers a severe knee injury that causes a lasting limp he struggles to fix.
Moves cautiously by slinking in and out of rooms in an apartment, showing stealth and awareness.
Goes into the bedroom and steals some jewelry, stuffing his pockets.
Listens attentively to the Master's rant about attacking and dominating their environment, showing engagement with the situation.
Tells Clark to get up and help him, suggesting camaraderie and involving him to make a good show

Engages Clark in casual conversation while walking through the streets, showing interest in him
Responds supportively and positively to Clark's experience and feelings about the book and cause.
Buzzes the buzzer to make a late night delivery, showing responsibility and consideration.
Smashes down John More's door and forcibly drags him along the floor, showing aggression and lack of respect.

Expresses limited understanding of complex ideas but shows willingness to engage and improve, acknowledges his own lack of understanding honestly.

Wakes up and thoughtfully processes the previous night's events, putting pieces together.
Delivers the handkerchief and confidently asserts that John More will not speak against the Master again.
Admits to attacking someone after being told to and acknowledges the person had a wise-ass mouth.
Refuses to fully disclose what he did, only says he scared the person good, avoiding revealing harm.

Dismisses family-related emotional issues by saying he doesn't really think about them, indicating emotional distance.

Refuses to explain what he did after attacking, withholding information.
Shows awareness of consequences by assuring he won't return to the Master or the Cause after the incident.
Dismisses complex family dynamics as 'yesterday's news,' showing a lack of deeper reflection on important personal issues.
Expresses simple dislike for 'smart-mouths' without deeper understanding of his own anger or motivations.
Complies with the Master's request to watch over someone and report back, shows willingness to serve.
Steals jewels from last night's party and hides them in his room.
Denies or downplays the praise Elizabeth gives for his effort helping her father.
Agreeing to keep an eye on Val and report back to the Master with casualness and readiness.
Refilling his booze supply and hiding stolen jewels from a party.
Telling Elizabeth he is 'working' and running 'errands' ambiguously, despite being called a loafer.
Downplaying his own contribution in helping the Master’s father, despite Elizabeth calling it spectacular.
Gently kisses Elizabeth back after she kisses him.
Refuses Elizabeth's request for liquor, citing concern that it is too strong for her.
Takes a large swig of booze after Elizabeth leaves the room, indicating possible internal struggle.
Refuses to share liquor with Elizabeth, citing the strength as a reason, and insists she obey, demonstrating some control and decisiveness.
Takes a large swig of booze after Elizabeth's retreat and undressing incident, suggesting reliance on alcohol to cope rather than addressing the situation effectively.
Follows Val quietly and watches him interact with others from a distance; observes the situation and reflects on it internally.
Makes a phone call to a friend, indicating he is seeking connection.

Pours a bit of his booze into the beers for the boys at the party.
Asks about family members, showing interest in others' lives (asks Bob where his mom is, and about his own mom).

Pours a tiny bit of his booze into the beers for the boys, initiating social interaction in an informal way.
Asks questions about family whereabouts (his mom, Bob's mom) showing some contextual awareness.
Brings up a topic about stolen jewels and money in the sewers near Harlem, indicating some curiosity or street smarts.

Suggests splitting up directions and invites others to follow him.

Leaves jewels and family photos with a note indicating he has gone to Africa, saying 'See you again sometime.'
Enters Master's hotel room quietly, gets into bed without disturbing or demanding attention while Master barely notices him.
Leaves behind the jewels, takes family photos and writes a note informing others of his departure, indicating a thoughtful and deliberate departure.

Considers Mary Sue's question seriously before answering honestly that he lost Val in the streets.
Drives the car attentively with Master asleep beside him and Mary Sue breastfeeding in the back, indicating responsibility and care.
Responds tersely and briefly to Mary Sue's questions, showing limited emotional engagement in conversation.
Takes the wheel and drives the car confidently with the Master and others inside.
Fails to notice or understand the interaction between Mary Sue and Val, giving a vague answer about losing them in the streets.
Discreetly fetches a drink and brings it to Master to help him relax during a long, rambling speech.

Observes the group's interaction quietly, does not intervene or disrupt.
Kicks chair to wake Val and encourages her to pay attention to the Master's speech, implying he values learning and attentiveness.
Insists that the Master is not improvising and that paying attention is important, showing confidence in his judgment.
Sits quietly watching Val and the proceedings, but does not intervene further or demonstrate overt skill or knowledge beyond his statements.

Hesitates and stays put when the policemen arrive, unsure of what to do.
He hesitates and is unsure how to respond when the policemen arrive, ultimately taking no effective action.
Refuses entry to the policemen with a blunt 'No. You cannot.' despite the situation escalating.
Looks out the door and observes the situation quietly without disrupting or escalating tension.

Fights violently and resists being calmed down by Master.

Does not actively respond effectively to the Master's attempts at guidance or strategies for survival, showing passivity and confusion.
Sits in silence with Clark outside the closed door, showing patience and a willingness to listen though not fully understanding.
Responds affirmatively and cooperatively when asked if he is prepared to travel for the mission.

Expresses willingness to travel and undertake an important mission despite personal challenges.
Asks about others involved, showing concern and attention to details (e.g., asking about Val).

Agrees to protect and safely deliver the box of valuables entrusted by the Master.
Reacted calmly and politely to the stewardess offering a cocktail by declining with thanks.
No evident display of warmth in interactions with Helen and Master beyond attending to their requests.
Listens carefully to Master's detailed instructions about retrieving and protecting a valuable box, and agrees to undertake the responsibility.
Responds simply and affirmatively ("Yeah") to a complex and important request without showing signs of clarifying or confirming details.
Refuses a cocktail on the plane, indicating awareness of his condition and a controlled decision to detox.
Enters a ransacked house cautiously, reacts with shock and nervousness, shows vigilance and respect for the place.
Digs up a dusty box from a crawl space and carefully preserves it, showing care and responsibility.
Approaches others politely, identifies himself properly, and acknowledges that he was expected, showing social courtesy.

Walks swiftly and purposefully, uses a key to enter house, quickly assesses ransacked environment, becomes on guard, searches under house crawl space, digs up a dusty box and secures it in his bag, then proceeds directly to his next destination and confidently introduces himself to branch manager.
Is very friendly and focused when meeting Dick Breton and requesting to use the phone.
Calmly and honestly reports the break-in details to Master without exaggeration or evasion.
Shows concern for safety and follows Master's instructions diligently.
Keeps the valuable box safe without opening it, demonstrating reliability and trustworthiness.

Shows some nervousness and shakiness after the break-in, uncertain about the intruder’s motive but follows instructions diligently.
Freddie tries to keep to himself, others give him space, he does not engage socially.

Registers a safe deposit box and puts something in it efficiently and without hesitation.
Appears shaky and sweaty while speaking to a group, struggles to conceal nervousness, reads from paper poorly.

Leads and organizes clean-up and refurbishment efforts, acts as main liaison and lieutenant, coordinates preparations for events, and engages actively in outreach by inviting people and handing out fliers.
Displays physical distress by vomiting violently during de-toxing, visibly shaking and sweating while speaking to followers, indicating nervousness and poor composure.
Speaks publicly despite visible anxiety, reads from a paper to convey plans for a congress and promotional messages on the radio, demonstrating effort to communicate and lead.
Successfully arranges and negotiates buying air-time from a local radio station, and reads a promotional piece confidently on air.

Explains the condition of the house to the Master with clarity and transparency.

Responds appropriately to the Master's requests (to get fresh ribbon and supplies, and to go to the bank the next morning), showing attentiveness and readiness to act.
Asks questions about Clark and a secret mission, showing curiosity about others' lives.

Sits outside alone smoking and drinking coffee, maintaining distance from others.

Prefers Doris to think ill of him to protect her feelings; shows self-sacrificing attitude.

Focuses on making a phone call to the Cause HQ, requesting help.
